meanings.definition: To refrain from harming or destroying
meanings.sent1: He spares the tiny ants when he sees them on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The kind gardener spares the delicate flowers from the harsh sun.
meanings.sent3: The little boy spares the spider because he thinks it's his friend.
meanings.sent4: She spares the old tree, seeing it as a wise guardian of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The hero always spares the villain, hoping for their redemption.

meanings.definition: Additional items kept in case of need
meanings.sent1: She always keeps spares of pencils in her bag for school.
meanings.sent2: The car owner had spares of keys hidden in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The hiker packed spares of socks in case his feet got wet.
meanings.sent4: The astronaut carried spares of oxygen tanks for the spacewalk.
meanings.sent5: The chef had spares of ingredients ready for any last-minute orders.

meanings.definition: To give or grant (something) to someone
meanings.sent1: He spares some change to the homeless man on the street.
meanings.sent2: The generous donor spares no effort in helping those in need.
meanings.sent3: She spares a smile to brighten the cashier's day.
meanings.sent4: The teacher spares extra time to explain the difficult concept to the student.
meanings.sent5: The parent spares no love in raising their children.

meanings.definition: To use or give (time, money, or other resources) freely or generously
meanings.sent1: She spares a moment to listen to her friend's worries.
meanings.sent2: The millionaire spares no expense in hosting grand parties.
meanings.sent3: He spares some change to buy a treat for his dog.
meanings.sent4: The company spares resources to support local charities.
meanings.sent5: The artist spares no creativity in painting vibrant masterpieces.
